sn48.9:1.3: The faculties of faith, energy, mindfulness, immersion, and wisdom.
sn48.9:1.4: And what is the faculty of faith?
sn48.9:1.5: It’s when a noble disciple has faith in the Realized One’s awakening:
sn48.9:1.6: ‘That Blessed One is perfected, a fully awakened Buddha, accomplished in knowledge and conduct, holy, knower of the world, supreme guide for those who wish to train, teacher of gods and humans, awakened, blessed.’
sn48.9:1.7: This is called the faculty of faith.
sn48.9:2.1: And what is the faculty of energy?
sn48.9:2.2: It’s when a mendicant lives with energy roused up for giving up unskillful qualities and embracing skillful qualities. They’re strong, staunchly vigorous, not slacking off when it comes to developing skillful qualities.
sn48.9:2.3: This is called the faculty of energy.
sn48.9:3.1: And what is the faculty of mindfulness?
sn48.9:3.2: It’s when a noble disciple is mindful. They have utmost mindfulness and alertness, and can remember and recall what was said and done long ago.
sn48.9:3.3: This is called the faculty of mindfulness.
sn48.9:4.1: And what is the faculty of immersion?
sn48.9:4.2: It’s when a noble disciple, relying on letting go, gains immersion, gains unification of mind.
sn48.9:4.3: This is called the faculty of immersion.
sn48.9:5.1: And what is the faculty of wisdom?
sn48.9:5.2: It’s when a noble disciple is wise. They have the wisdom of arising and passing away which is noble, penetrative, and leads to the complete ending of suffering.
sn48.9:5.3: This is called the faculty of wisdom.
